text:
Hi everyone. I'm Jennifer
from English with Jennifer. Here's a

quick lesson about the suffix
-ous. You'll see variations, like

joyous, religious, courageous.
As you can see, a suffix is a word part.

More specifically, it's an ending. When we
stick it at the end of a word,

we form an adjective. The suffix -ous
means that someone or something has a
certain quality.

A joyous occasion is characterized by
joy.

A religious text is related to religion,
and a courageous act is done out of courage.

Why does it help to understand word
parts?

Well, first of all, it helps you recognize
the part of speech.

And second, it can help you guess the
meaning of a new word.

Also, in this case, you can learn a stress
pattern.

With -ious and -eous,
we stress the syllable before the suffix.
Repeat after me.
religious
ambitious
nutritious
delicious
gorgeous
courageous
outrageous

advantageous
Now let me quiz you. If something is
religious, it's related to religion. Right?

So, if something is nutritious, it has
good...
nutrition.

Next, if you have an advantageous
position,
then you have the...
advantage.

If someone's actions are outrageous,
then these actions cause...

outrage.
If your co-worker is ambitious, they're
driven by...
ambition.

Let's increase the challenge and look at
a word family.
Choose the right word to complete the sentence.

Mike's claims are hard to believe. They
raise some suspicion.

Yolanda doesn't always tell the truth. I
suspect that she's lying about what happened.

If you enter a bank with a hat and
sunglasses,
you may look suspicious.

Note this word family: suspect,
suspicion, suspicious.

Suspicious.
We'll end here. Please review the words

from this lesson.
Remember that adjectives can end in -ous,

and the suffix means that someone or
something

has a certain quality. Hopefully, you'll
be more

conscious of word parts and word
formation now.

Please like the video if you found it
helpful. As always, thanks for watching

and happy studies!
Follow me on Facebook, Twitter, and

Instagram. And try something new!
Download the app Hallo and join me for

a live stream.
Students can hop on camera and get
speaking practice in real time.
